title: Congratulating Roxanne Fratezi upon setting an age group world record at the 2010 Northeast Regional Single Lift Powerlifting Championships
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  Roxanne Fratezi upon setting an
age group world record at the 2010 Northeast Regional Single Lift Power-
lifting Championships

WHEREAS, Excellence and success in competitive sports  can  be  achieved
only  through  strenuous  practice,  nurtured  by dedicated coaching and
strategic planning; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize and pay
tribute to those esteemed individuals within the State of New  York  who
distinguish  themselves  through  outstanding  achievements in worldwide
athletic competition; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to congratu-
late Roxanne Fratezi upon setting an age group world record at the  2010
Northeast Regional Single Lift Powerlifting Championships; and
  WHEREAS,  The  event  was  held  at Johnson City Senior High School on
Saturday, May 29, 2010, and drew about  80  different  competitors  from
nine states; and
  WHEREAS,  Roxanne  Fratezi's  overall  record  is outstanding; she was
loyally and enthusiastically supported by family, fans, friends and  the
community at large; and
  WHEREAS, A Johnson City resident, Roxanne Fratezi picked up 245 pounds
in  the  deadlift  competition, which is a record for the 50-54-year-old
age group; and
  WHEREAS, Sports competition instills the  values  of  self-motivation,
pride  and  accomplishment,  and  Roxanne  Fratezi  has  clearly  made a
contribution to the spirit of excellence which is  a  tradition  of  her
community; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Roxanne Fratezi upon setting an age group world  record  at
the  2010 Northeast Regional Single Lift Powerlifting Championships; and
be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Roxanne Fratezi.
